original_solution_mapping.L1: 9 students have an average age of 8 years so the sum of their ages is 9*8 = <<9*8=72>>72 years
original_solution_mapping.L2: A tenth student who is 28 years old will make the sum 72+28 = 100 years
original_solution_mapping.L3: The new average age will be 100/10 = <<100/10=10>>10 years
original_solution_mapping.L4: This is 10-8 = <<10-8=2>>2 years higher than the previous average.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2187.
    Returns: the increase in the average age of the students.
    """
    # L1
    num_students_initial = 9 # 9 students
    average_age_initial = 8 # average age of 9 of them is 8 years
    sum_ages_initial = num_students_initial * average_age_initial

    # L2
    age_tenth_student = 28 # the tenth student is (quite strangely) 28 years old
    sum_ages_new = sum_ages_initial + age_tenth_student

    # L3
    total_students_new = 10 # 10 students in a class
    average_age_new = sum_ages_new / total_students_new

    # L4
    increase_in_average = average_age_new - average_age_initial

    # FA
    answer = increase_in_average
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: {num_students_initial} students have an average age of {average_age_initial} years so the sum of their ages is {num_students_initial}*{average_age_initial} = <<{num_students_initial}*{average_age_initial}={sum_ages_initial}>>{sum_ages_initial} years
A tenth student who is {age_tenth_student} years old will make the sum {sum_ages_initial}+{age_tenth_student} = {sum_ages_new} years
The new average age will be {sum_ages_new}/{total_students_new} = <<{sum_ages_new}/{total_students_new}={average_age_new}>>{average_age_new} years
This is {average_age_new}-{average_age_initial} = <<{average_age_new}-{average_age_initial}={increase_in_average}>>{increase_in_average} years higher than the previous average.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: 9 students have an average age of 8 years so the sum of their ages is 9*8 = <<9*8=72>>72 years
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: A tenth student who is 28 years old will make the sum 72+28 = 100 years
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: The new average age will be 100/10 = <<100/10=10>>10 years
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: This is 28-8 = <<28-8=20>>20 years higher than the previous average.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'age_tenth_student' (value: 28) was used instead of 'average_age_new' (value: 10.0).
